importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: This is the date of the article's update, indicating when the final outcome of the ALCS and the Blue Jays' path to the World Series was confirmed.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The time frame covers the duration of the ALCS, culminating in Game 7 on October 21, 2025, which determined the American League champion for the World Series.

keyTakeAways: George Springer's three-run home run in the seventh inning of Game 7 propelled the Toronto Blue Jays to a 4-3 victory over the Seattle Mariners, securing their spot in the World Series.
The Blue Jays are headed to their first World Series since 1993, marking a historic milestone for the franchise and Canadian baseball.
Controversial play involving Jorge Polanco and Ernie Clement, where a ricochet off Naylor's helmet led to a disputed call, highlighted the drama and tension of the game.
Vladimir Guerrero Jr. was named ALCS MVP with a .385 batting average and three home runs in the series.
The Seattle Mariners, the only MLB franchise never to appear in a World Series, remain a historic outlier in baseball history.
George Springer, despite being injured in Game 5, returned to pitch and play in Games 6 and 7, showing grit and dedication to the team and fans.
The Blue Jays will face the Los Angeles Dodgers in the World Series, pitting the AL’s best team against the defending champion.
Chris Bassitt and Jeff Hoffman shut down the Mariners in the eighth and ninth innings, respectively, sealing the victory.

namedEntities.name: George Springer
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Major League Baseball player, designated hitter
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His three-run home run in Game 7 of the ALCS was the decisive moment that turned the tide and sent the Blue Jays to the World Series.

namedEntities.name: Toronto Blue Jays
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Professional baseball team based in Toronto, Canada
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: They won the American League Championship Series, earning their first World Series appearance since 1993 and becoming the focus of national attention.

namedEntities.name: Seattle Mariners
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Professional baseball team based in Seattle, Washington
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: They lost Game 7 of the ALCS, marking their first playoff defeat and ending a long playoff drought in the franchise's history.

namedEntities.name: Los Angeles Dodgers
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Professional baseball team based in Los Angeles, California
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: They are the defending champions and the opponent in the upcoming World Series, creating a high-stakes matchup.

namedEntities.name: Vladimir Guerrero Jr.
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Major League Baseball player, center fielder
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He was named ALCS MVP with a .385 average and three home runs, demonstrating exceptional performance in the postseason.

namedEntities.name: Julio Rodriguez
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Major League Baseball player, center fielder
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He homered in the third and fifth innings of Game 7, helping Seattle take leads during the game.

namedEntities.name: Cal Raleigh
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He hit a key home run in the fifth inning and had a strong playoff performance, including a record 60 home runs during the regular season.

namedEntities.name: Josh Naylor
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He drove in Julio Rodriguez with a single in the first inning and was involved in the controversial play that led to a disputed call.

namedEntities.name: Jorge Polanco
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He hit a groundball that led to a controversial on-field call involving Ernie Clement and Josh Naylor.

namedEntities.name: Ernie Clement
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Major League Baseball player, third baseman
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He fielded a grounder from Polanco and attempted a double play, which ricocheted off Naylor’s helmet, leading to a key play that sparked controversy.

namedEntities.name: Daulton Varsho
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He drove in a run in the first inning to tie the game, helping Toronto maintain momentum.

namedEntities.name: Shane Bieber
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He pitched for the Mariners and gave up a home run in the third inning that gave Seattle a 2-1 lead.

namedEntities.name: Eduardo Bazardo
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He entered the game in the seventh inning and was the pitcher facing George Springer when Springer hit his game-winning home run.

namedEntities.name: Chris Bassitt
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He pitched a scoreless eighth inning in Game 7, helping preserve the Blue Jays’ lead.

namedEntities.name: Jeff Hoffman
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He closed the game in the ninth inning, striking out all three Mariners batters to end the game.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The Toronto Blue Jays overcame a dramatic and tense American League Championship Series matchup against the Seattle Mariners to win Game 7 4-3, propelled by a pivotal three-run home run from George Springer in the seventh inning. The game featured controversy over a groundball play where a ricochet off Josh Naylor’s helmet led to a disputed call. Vladimir Guerrero Jr. was named ALCS MVP for his stellar performance, and the Blue Jays advance to face the defending champion Los Angeles Dodgers in the World Series. This victory marks the Blue Jays’ first World Series appearance since 1993 and is a historic milestone for Canadian baseball.
title: George Springer’s epic home run helps send the Toronto Blue Jays to the World Series with ALCS Game 7 win over Seattle
